sentences.en: Governors are using the increased powers given to them to act against incompetent headteachers.
sentences.cn: 董事们运用赋予他们的更大权力罢免不称职的校长。

sentences.en: He is incompetent at working with his hands.
He is quite incompetent to do the work.
He is utterly incompetent at his job.
sentences.cn: 他完全不能胜任他的工作.

sentences.en: He wants the power to sack incompetent teachers.
sentences.cn: 他想取得解雇不称职老师的权力。
他被认为无能而遭辞退.
他能力较弱,但工作还是勤勤恳恳的.

sentences.en: He's incompetent, he'll have to go.
sentences.cn: 他不称职, 得辞掉他.

sentences.en: Hugh was so incompetent, for all that he tried so hard.
sentences.cn: 休虽然非常努力,却极不称职.

sentences.en: I was incompetent at playing the piano.
Lazy and incompetent police officers are letting the public down.
sentences.cn: 懒惰兼无能的警官令公众失望。

sentences.en: The court declared him incompetent to manage his financial affairs.
sentences.cn: 法庭宣布他不具备管理自己财务的能力。

sentences.en: The journalist slanted the report so that the mayor was made to appear incompetent.
sentences.cn: 那位记者做出歪曲报道好让市长显得无能.

sentences.en: The man was a fool, he thought, or at least incompetent.
sentences.cn: 他想道，那人是个傻瓜，或者说，至少很无能。

sentences.en: The president turned furiously on his staff. "I'm surrounded by incompetents!"
sentences.cn: 董事长愤怒地指责其职员，“我身边全是些没用的人！”

sentences.en: You may see yourself as useless, incompetent and blameworthy.
sentences.cn: 你也许会认为自己无用、不称职、应该受到指责。

words.tran_cn: 无资格，不胜任；无能力；不适当；不熟练

trans.tran_cn: 无能力的，不胜任的，不适当的
trans.tran_en: not having the ability or skill to do a job properly
An incompetent is someone who is incompetent
